document.docTitle: Hydroporus bodemeyeri subsp. guignoti Gschwendtner 1935, stat. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Hydroporus bodemeyeri species complex (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae) with a geometric morphometric analysis of body shape within the group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the Hydroporus bodemeyeri species complex (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae) with a geometric morphometric analysis of body shape within the group

bibRefCitation.author: Gschwendtner L
bibRefCitation.refString: Gschwendtner L. 1935. Zwei neue europaische Schwimmkafer. Entomol Anz. 15: 151 - 152.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hydroporus ( Heterosternus ) bulgaricus Hlisnikovský, 1955: 100
(original description) syn. revid.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality. H. guignoti
: “ Albanien ( Tirana )” [ Albania , ca. 7 km north-east of Tirana , Mal i Dajtit, ca. 41°21′ N , 19°55′ E ];
H. bulgaricus
: “Paril, Alibotuš planina,

Bulgaria occid.” [nowadays called Slavyanka Mountains , ca. 20 km south-west of Gotse Delchev , ca. 41°25′ N , 23°37′ E ]
.

Type material. H. guignoti
:
Holotype female [sic!] ( OLML ): “MAL-I-DAJTIT/ TIRANE [handwritten] // ALBANIA / LEG. BISCHOFF / 1931 [handwritten] // Type Ƌ / Gsch. [= Gschwendtner] [handwritten, pink label] // Coll. / Gschwendtner [printed] // Hydroporus / Guignoti Gsch [handwritten] / det. Gschwendt. [printed] // Type [handwritten, red label] // Hydroporus / guignoti Gschw. / = bodemeyeri Ganglb. [handwritten] / det. Wewalka 70 [printed]”
.
Paratypes ( OLML )
: one female ,
same label data as holotype, but “ Paratype ” instead of “Type”
; one female ,
“Parnass / Graecia [printed] // Type ♀ / Gsch. [handwritten, pink label] // Coll. / Gschwendtner [printed] // Hydr. ♀ II / Guignoti Gsch. [handwritten] / det. Gschwendt. [printed] // Type [handwritten, red label] // Hydroporus / guignoti Gschw. / = bodemeyeri Ganglb. [handwritten] / det. Wewalka 70 [printed]”
; one male , one female ,
same label data as holotype, but “ Paratype ” instead of “Type”.
H. bulgaricus
:
Holotype female [sic!] ( NMPC ): “Alibotuš pl. [planina, = mountains] / Bulg. [Bulgaria], 15.6.[19]38 / Hlisnikowski [printed, date handwritten] // Type [printed, red label with black frame] // Coll. Hlisnikovský / Mus. Nat. Pragae [printed] // HYDROPORUS / BULHARICUS [sic!] HLIS. [handwritten] / det. Hlisnikovský 1952 [printed]” ( NMPC )
.

Additional material examined.
Albania : one female , Borske , 1940, Bischoff leg. ( OLML )
.
Bulgaria : five males , two females , Blagoevgrad distr. , Sandanski env., valley of Lebnica river , stream,
26 May 1998
, J. Hájek leg. ( HFCB , NMPC )
;
one male , Kurdzhali distr. , Kaloyantsi env., stream,
28 June 1999
, J. Hájek leg. ( NMPC )
;
three males , one female , Smolyan distr. , 3 km west Smolyan , Gerzovica stream valley,
4 July 1999
, J. Hájek leg. ( HFCB , NMPC )
.
Greece : one male , two females , Aitoloakarnania distr. , 30 km south of Agrénion ,
4 May 1971
, G. Wewalka leg. ( HFCB , NMPC )
;
four males , one female , Levkás Island ,
11 September 1988
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
one male , Thásos Island [Kavala distr.], Megálos Prínos ,
11 September 1991
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
two males , one female , Thásos Isl. , N Theológos ,
12.ix.1991
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
1 female , Thásos Island , Potamiás ,
13 September 1991
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
three females , Euboea Island [Evvoia distr.], Steni-Stroponas ,
700-900 m
,
30 September 1992
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
three females , Samothráki Island , [Évros distr.], 1 km west of Kremniotsa ,
15 June 1993
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
one male , one female , Khalkidhikí , Athos [ Ágion Óros Peninsula], 2 km north-west of Megistis Lavras , ca.
30 m
,
3 July 2002
, M.A. Jäch leg. ( NHMW )
;
four males , six females , Xanthi distr. , ca. 10 km east of Stavroúpolis , 41°12.4′ N , 24°47.7′ E , ca.
360 m
, stream,
25–26 April 2007
, J. Hájek leg. ( NMPC )
.
Measurements. Body length: 3.10–3.40 mm (mean value = 3.27 mm ), width: 1.40–1.55 mm (mean 1.48 mm ).

Description. Similar to nominotypical subspecies in general habitus. Usually slightly smaller; sides of elytra more curved, so pronoto-elytral angle more distinct than in nominotypical subspecies ( Figure 3D ). Punctation on pronotum and elytra coarser and deeper. Distance between punctures about that of their diameter, in particular in basal half of elytra.
Female: microreticulation of elytra usually more distinct than in males so surface subopaque. Claws of fore legs thin, only slightly curved.
Habitat. Collected in gravel and under submerged leaves in small temporary streams.
Distribution. A subspecies which occurs in the Balkan Peninsula. Known from Albania , southern Bulgaria and Greece , including the islands of Euboea, Levkás, Samothráki and Thásos ( Figure 6 ).
